thread.title: Cops: Suspects stole $20K in iPhones from Mall of Georgia kiosk
thread.title_full: Cops: Suspects stole $20K in iPhones from Mall of Georgia kiosk

author: Amanda C. Coyne
title: Cops: Suspects stole $20K in iPhones from Mall of Georgia kiosk
text:
Gwinnett County police are looking for four people suspected of stealing $20,000 in iPhones from a Sprint kiosk at the Mall of Georgia.
The burglaries took place on Jan. 5 and Feb. 14. Both occurred shortly after midnight, when the mall was closed. Three men and one woman were seen taking 18 phones on surveillance tape during the first incident, and two men and one woman were seen taking 16 phones on tape during the second.
Forsyth man charged with sending lewd pictures to Gwinnett professor
The suspectsâ€™ identities are not known, but images have been captured from the surveillance videos.
Anyone with information related to this case should contact Gwinnett County detectives at 770-513-5300 or Crime Stoppers at 404-577-8477. Crime Stoppers tips can be rewarded with up to $2,000 if they lead to an arrest or indictment.
